intro: Coussapoa ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a stout, woody stem and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Coussapoa ferruginea is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests.
